description: Smallest prime that divides k^2 + k + n for k = 0, 1, 2, ....
formula: a(n)=2 if n is equal to 0, 2 or 4 modulo 6; a(n)=3 if n is equal to 1 or 3 modulo 6.
example: To obtain a(7), note that x^2+x+7 takes the values 7,9,13,19,... for k=0,1,2,... and the smallest prime dividing these numbers is 3.
crossrefs: Cf. A060380, A060392-A060398. A060396 gives values of k.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 04 2001
